sentence.text: The insulin-secreting pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors, insulinomas, characterized by increased pancreatic islet β-cell proliferation, express the phosphorylated isoform of the β-cell differentiation factor regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II that interacts with activation of innate immune response/p54NRB, a survival factor.

entity.text: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Also, two somatic heterozygous activation of innate immune response mutations were found in endocrine-related tumors, p.H146R (parathyroid) and p.R293H (small intestine neuroendocrine tumor).

Overall, our results highlight the importance of regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II in conditions of β-cell excess (insulinomas) and in conditions of β-cell loss or dysfunction (diabetes).

entity.text: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
